reviewText:
I never watched this animated series when it was actually on, but my son is a huge fan of the trilogy. So with the passing of 'Back to the Future' day I thought this would make a cool gift since he's the right age for the series, (10).
He loves it! There are drawbacks, (most notably the absence of the voice work by Michael J Fox, and (which my son noticed) that Marty wasn't in every episodes, only some of them), but other than that he enjoys watching it.
It has science, it has history, and while not necessarily educational it's not a bad way to get some interest going.
It's campy, its unique, it was definitely worth the 30bucks or so that I spent.

I had all of these recorded on VHS from when they originally aired on TV. I was so happy these were finally being released on DVD, because the quality on mine were pretty crappy. Unfortunately, they quality on these aren't much better, and some of the live action Doc Brown scenes are badly out of sync. The series itself is great...5 stars...but the quality of the DVDs is very disappointing.

The main reason this is great for adult collectors to is to finally have an official release of everything Back to the Future ever (there have been a number of unofficial releases).  Hearing Mary Steenburgen and Tom Wilson reprising their roles is also a plus.  The only downside is that some of these stories can be really messed up, and that there's no clean-up at all on the animation.

Apparently it was a great series for kids when it came out (I was a teenager and had grown out of it),  and if any parents would love to get their kids interested in the movie trilogy, this might series be the key.
i still own the official VHS copies of these...glad to see they will finally be on dvd...
Thank god they are FINALLY putting this series out on dvd. This was by far, my favorite saturday morning cartoon of the 90s.
Yes, finally. I love this show so much. I have been waiting for this forever, can't wait.
A cute cartoon, and if you love BTTF you will enjoy this animated version with tons of adventures
love it

My son loved it!
Haven't watched it yet but love that it arrived fast and was in one piece that's a plus. Never even knew BTTF even came out with a cartoon series until now. Thanks for beginning my childhood back.

Would've been better with Christopher Lloyd providing the voice of Doc Brown, but didn't do a bad job as is.  Interesting on how they portray the historical aspects while teaching a lesson to kids.

This series is excellent ! The animated adventures coupled with the science experiments make this an engaging and educational experience for children of all ages ! I don't understand why this series is not aired on a TV station today ... SO glad to have this in my DVD library !!

Now i had never seen a episode of the animation series because when it was on tv i basically didn't watch Saturday morning cartoons because i was only in to gijoe and the transformers i had actually bought a comic based on the cartoon that i payed 50 cents for at a comic book store but i got my cartoon series in that 30 anniversary flux set and i love it being a fan of back to the future now every fan of back to the future should have this cartoon series because 2 episodes even come with the 30 anniversary alone and you can get it in that limited edition flux that is where i got mine are you can buy the series alone all 4 discs you won't be dissapointed.

Product was sealed brand new but piece in side was broken! Disk play great though!

An engaging collection of stories built off characters of 'Back to the Future III'. Mary, now in college occasionally visits Doc's family (wife, dog, and two sons) which results in adventures to the Civil War, medieval England, 'Land Before Time 2', Salem Witch Trials, Ancient Rome, Ben Franklin, the Incas and more.

Each episode includes an introduction by Christopher Lloyd as Doc and then the episode followed by a scientific experiment related to the episode done by Bill Nye. Biff's character appears in each time period to be the rival. Additionally there is usually a joke or a factoid. Engaging stories. Well done. Twenty four episodes which appeared  over two seasons. Entertaining and enlightening as it aspires to teach lessons.
kids love it
Nice book, Thank you!!
A must-have for any hardcore Back fan, honestly. And these shows are a fun, light watch.

Love it. I used to watch this series all the time. My favorite episodes are included like Forward to the Past, Dickens of a Christmas, and Clara's Folks. Kids can learn about science and history. This is perfect for kids to enjoy until their old enough to see the films.
